name: TechMan
title: Best 21" 1080P Monitor, In-Depth review.
content: First of all It’s the best 1080P 22” 75Hz in it’s price(7500) and I’m saying it after my research based purchase and after purchase experience.. Contents:-. came with Monitor!, 2 piece modular stand, VGA cable, HDMI cable thankfully!, AUX cable nice!, power cord and power brick, some paperwork. *************************. Ports:-. HDMI, VGA, AUX input(can’t be used as output when sound is coming from HDMI), power input. *************************. Looks and feel:-. It’s so different and better looking than those full black monitor and on the inside it’s 75Hz display so it’s a totally different experience inside and out with this monitor, the white portion of this monitor stands out beautifully, the main display is half as thick as a usb plug display is matt finish so it doesn't matter if there’s light source in front of it. *************************. Display:-. Vibrant output, Beautiful color production, No dead pixels and no color bleeding. Some people had issue with color bleeding but not me, supports freesync and capable of 75 FPS output, I haven’t noticed any stain on eyes 10+ continuous hours and I’m a guy with glasses.. It’s a 75 hz display, i’ve used 60Hz display for 11 years and it makes a difference it’s only display in this price range with this feature and sealed the deal for me.. You can game on it no problems just know that this monitor doesn't sell as gaming monitor and gsync and display overclocking support is not available, it has 4 MS response time and is better at gaming than other similar monitors and some expensive monitors too. **********************. Speaker and sound:-. it has 2, 2 watt speakers in the bottom which is not loud at all and lacks basic bass I'm not asking for much just enough, for reference my poco F1 has loud and clear speaker than this dual speaker monitor it’s just there and you shouldn't rely on it but is a nice addition, something is better than nothing. For speaker to work you can give input by HDMI cable and if you are using VGA there’s aux input too. ***************************. Manual setting suggestion:-. This is a 75 Hz display so first of all check that your graphics unit has enabled 75Hz from normally 60Hz refresh rate to enjoy it’s full capability. Factory display setting of this monitor was with a warm color to give feelings of blue light protection which was not looking normal so you may have to tweak the settings to fit your needs. ***************************. One thing to keep in mind that it’s a 21.5 inch 1080P monitor which has a 102.46 per inch that means if you use it in its native resolution text might be smaller for you, text is totally readable and clear but small so I have custom scaled this monitor to 109% now everything is fine for the monitor but windows OS is bad at scaling some text are blurry like chrome suggestion which is totally not a big deal but something to keep in mind and if you buy 24 inch monitor the price of that is just shy of double the price of this monitor.. *****. If we are talking about eye care than this monitor doesn’t put strain on eyes just set it to comfortable brightness and use a blue light filter like flu.x or use windows 10’s night light feature

name: mohit
title: Perfect monitor
content: Best budget monitor in this price

name: Nitish Sadhwa
title: Good product
content: It's a good gaming monitor with 4ms response time and 75hz refresh rate. And the screen is amazing. The only issue is backlight bleeding along the edges which noticeable when the screen display dark colors. Doesn't get distracting tho.

name: Subhasish N.
title: Best at this price range 🔥
content: So, here it is guys♥️. Got it for ₹8999 on amazon sale. I posted about this on Facebook earlier after ordering from Amazon that if is it okay and everyone like "Hell No" go for LG or this is not a good monitor.. I just bought it at my own risk as it don't have much reviews on Youtube nither on Amazon (Only 45 reviews). Whatever,I just wanna say this is a underrated White beast/beauty.. 4ms 75hz out of the box, Ultra Thin.. Most Loved AMD Free-sync.. No major backlight bleeding issue like LG and Samsung have.(I attached a photo of dark scene to detect any bleeding). And the colour reproduction quality is just insane 🔥. Also comes with 2 piece of 2w speaker though it's not loud but it's better to have those.. The white colour is just giving it a look of extraordinary.. It don't comes with a DP port so the HDMI port is 2.0 unlike 1.4 on other monitors (Free-sync supports only via HDMI 2.0). At last , I just want that youtubers should review this underrated monitor.

name: Scizor
title: Bleeding, banding, acer never.
content: Its nice, 75hz refresh rate, good colors, average contrast , BUT it has some backlight bleed, check carefully, buyers.. Edit : replacement is even worse, it has backlight bleed at different places, and color banding too, banding is worse than the tn panel of my laptop.

name: Sam Developer
title: Overall Good
content: I like packaging! And no damage as i expected!. About led Its work amazing but back light bleeding.... Its start flicking so i try to return 2 time.. i recognized it was a problem with windows 10 auto color picking... Thumbs Up for great product ..... Its worth for money 14K but i think its comes to 12K for good

name: Deepak kumat
title: bad product and color
content: not happy with color quality

name: Vinoth Natarajan
title: Best in class
content: As the WFH became the new normal, I wanted an additional monitor to be added to my laptop. I was expecting a HD monitor with an HDMI extension as my laptop didnt have a VGA port. After a bit of research, narrowed down on this monitor after seeing the reviews - definitely not disappointed. I have been using this for over a month now. I can say that I am very much satisfied - have to wait for few more months to see its actual performace.. Pros:. 1. Really thin panel. 2. Provide HDMI & VGA connectivity for older PCs as well.. 3. Package has all the extension cords (HDMI, VGA, AUX, etc). 4. Has 2w in-built speaker - not so great but can be useful sometimes. You can use the AUX extension to draw the audio out from monitor to any external speakers.. 5. Stand is easy to fix and holds the monitor perfectly. Cons:. 1. Again very thin panel, looks delicate while handling - too risky if you keep moving your montior. 2. I see a blue light leak on top the screen - you will notice when you see that from top of the monitor (see image). 3. No wall mounting option - so those who work with multiple monitors can't put them in the strut bracket.. 4. Locating the menu buttons is too hard at times, there is no written description on the bottom panel rather acer has given on screen navigation. I always use the blue power light to locate the power button and from there.

name: Nitesh Kumar Jha
title: Few Dead Pixels on arrival else Fabulous Quality
content: The product is Great,,. Irrespective of What everyone is saying about backlight bleeding or Contrast etc,, picture quality is Really great.. IPS panel seems flawless, Contrast nd brightness are also great.. 75Hz with Amd freesync, FHD 1080p, With speakers, HDMI cable included, it really feels smooth.. The only problem I had is this That There is a pink patch or say dead pixels in middle of the screen which only appears when screen is fully black,, still very annoying.. Hoping for a Replacement.. Seller:- Appario

name: PD
title: Good product from Acer, but build quality can be improved
content: This is my 2nd ever monitor from Acer. 1st one was Aopen which I still regret buying. The Aopen is pretty bad display. So after my 1st experience with Acer I was reluctant to go for Acer again. I had a few options in mind like Samsung LS24R350FHWXXL, Dell P2419H, Zebronics ZEB-A24FHD, AOC 24V2Q. Each one had some pros and cons. But finally I decided to go for Acer - color and thickness of the panel.. received the monitor in good condition with an extra cardboard box packing on top of monitor company packing. As soon as I opened it, it just took away my mind. The white color looks awesome and the thickness of the panel is just too less for it to look the most sleek of monitors. Its bezel less and the colors are good too. Using this for a month now and all good, though initial few days it took time to adjust to the colors switching to this one form my old monitor, but now its fine.. Please don't buy this for speakers as they are worst, hardly any sound from them. So speakers are just a gimmick. I hope the stand could have been a little more sturdy. Stand looks awesome in white but if that could have been a bit more solid, it would have been great.. Overall, this monitor is worth a buy.

name: gagan parida
title: Pros and Cons ❤️💔 don't think it is good .
content: Pros :. >Style , ips , slim , amd free sync.. Cons:. >Over grains. Over sharpness. Over style. That's all . I'll recommend you not to buy by seeing it's appearance. Fonts aren't smooth , e.g bitmap font quality.. And there is no quality driver in official acer website .. How to fix fuzzyness :. >By explaining yourself that you have bought a good monitor.. > By sitting at distance so that your sight wont encounter that sharp fuzzy pixelated quality.. > By rate it 1 in Amazon and flipkart .. Thanks for reading

Guys full review of this monitor will be uploaded whithin a week on my channel Dezire 2 Tech do check out and from there u can decide whether to place the order or not Thankyou

name: Rajapara Jay Rameshbhai
title: A Best monitor.
content: I am writing this review after using this monitor for 1 year exactly.. **I am editing this review. ( first, I write 5star before few months but now I am facing some issue hence reducing stars). I don't play games so I can't say how this monitor performs in gaming.. I bought this monitor for my design and editing/production purposes. and this monitor was very best for it until last week.. Now it has started showing very strong ghosting effact hence now I can't look at the screen correctly.. wherever the white area on screen is, it shows gosting/motion blur and it pain the eyes if look at that area.. this is just staring hence I don't know if this effect will increase in future or not but will update this review according to it in future.. another problem I found is 1 dead pixel at around middle top area of the screen and heavy backlight bleeding at dark-screen which really don't bother me for now compare to this ghosting effact. If this will increase then I have to buy another monitor because it is already hurting me while working.. If I talking about good thing about this monitor then it has very good display and color quality and monitor has also slim and cool design.

title: I purchased and returned twice

The volume is too low that the inbuilt speaker is only useful in mid-nights in a very silent environment. You need extra speakers.. I purchased a LG after returning this. Paid 2 K more. No backlight bleeding. No need of extra speakers. High volume.

name: Amazon Customer
title: Detailed review
content: Cons:. 1.) There are two many wires as it's has a separate laptop like adapter for plugin.. 2.) Inbuild speakers are useless, better if is not available, I mean 2 watt speaker, not sure what is the purpose.. 3.) There is a AUX in cable, the speaker itself is useless, what's the means of input cable, it's better to have AUX out, at least you can use external speaker to permanently fix on your table.. 4.) There is not a single USB port.. 5.) There is no adjustment of screen, not even tilted one forget up and down.. 6.) For my use I don't feel the adjustment is right, moreover you don't have choice to adjust.. 7.) There are many wires visible on table, there is no holding point in monitor.. 8.) Decent price. Pros:. 1.) The white color looks awesome. 2.) Bazzle free design. 3) Superb slim. 4.) light weight - 2.5 KG. I feel if the height/tilt adjustment and inbuild adapter is present, this would be incomparable choice
